question: Which of the following statements regarding judicial review is correct?
option1: It is a part of the basic structure of the Constitution
option2: It can be curtailed through an amendment
option3: Only Supreme Court can exercise judicial review
option4: Only legislative enactments can be examined through judicial review
answer: It is a part of the basic structure of the Constitution
explanation: Judicial review has been declared by the Supreme Court as one of the elements of the basic structure of the Constitution, therefore, it cannot be curtailed even through a constitutional amendment. Both Supreme Court and High Court have the power of judicial review. And using judicial review, legislative enactments and executive orders of both the Central and State governments can be examined.
